meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: The small bell was chining softly in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I heard the church bells chining as I walked by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was chining loudly with a tiny bell around its neck.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chined through the room like a delicate bell.
meanings.sent5: The chining of the wind chimes filled the garden with a peaceful melody.

meanings.definition: The act of producing a high-pitched ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: The chining of the wind chimes brought a sense of calm to the patio.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the distant chining of a bell in the valley.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected chining of the doorbell made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The chining of the bicycle bell signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The sweet chining of the music box lulled the baby to sleep.

meanings.definition: The sound of a bell or bells ringing.
meanings.sent1: The chining of the bells echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The joyful chining of the wedding bells filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The chining of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: The chining of the doorbell announced the arrival of guests.
meanings.sent5: The distant chining of the church bells added a magical touch to the evening.
